review: We live in an area that is not connected to cable and our only internet provider is a phone line--not the most user friendly to watch streamingTV. We dropped the satellyte. We had an early roku device which did not have caption ability. It served us fairly well but one of us really needs captions and with some of the British series, we both need captions. Now all the netflix has captions and I can down load movie rentals and any tv series that I might want and watch them without interruption. My phone line does take a while to down load so I try to do most of that job over night. The Apple product seems to be more efficient and even when watching streaming there is less buffering than before. While we are buying some of the programs from the Apple Store, we are still saving money over subscribing to a satelyte company that forces you to buy so much programing you don't want and never watch .  My husband and I are very happy with this product .
author: judith a bell

review: Easy to hook up but all of my purchased movies don't show up.  About 1/3 of my collection can't be streamed from the cloud because they aren't showing up as purchased. review: I thought the concept was that whatever is on your iPad or iPhone could be put up on the big screen.This not the case.The very first thing I tried to watch - a video on my Amazon Prime account - could not be displayed.This $100 product pretty much only works with Netflix and Hulu. author: Amazon Customer

review: Why they didn't allow apps to load on it or safari, I have no idea? This would be in every home in America if that was the case. I like the fact I can mirror my iPads and iPhones to it, but forget about trying to get a web browser on it. If you own a Mac this is a must have. It works good with my windows computers if you leave iTunes up and running. Great picture quality on my projector which doesn't have smart apps, and would be good for anyone who has a good tv but not a smart tv. If you have a smart tv, I'm afraid this cool device wouldn't be good for particuarly special for anything but watching your iTunes content. You can mirror anything from your iPhone or iPad except safari? If somebody knows a work around for this please let me know. Otherwise this is just another cool apple device that can run, iTunes, netflx youtube and Hulu in highdef
